Rates of Exchange for Purchase and S a l e of Foreign Currency Notes
I. The Central Bank's rates for the purchase and sale of foreign currency notes from commercial banks will be as follows:—
Central Bank's Currency Buying Rate Selling Rate
( xiv )
Circular N o . 82 Central Bank of Ceylon
P. O. Box 590, Colombo I,
Commercial Bank Credit

1. The attention of commercial banks is invited to Circular No. 50 dated April I, 1972, which stipulated that until further notice commercial banks should refrain from increasing credit for non-essential purposes such as consumption, speculative stock building, etc.

2. Commercial banks are now informed that the Central Bank does not wish commercial banks to increase credit for any purpose. Accordingly, commercial banks are hereby informed that they should, until further notice, refrain from increa­sing credit over the level as on May 24th, 1974.

3. The Central Bank also wishes to impress on commercial banks the need to provide credit for essential purposes. Accordingly, the Central Bank also desires that in complying with the provisions of this Circular commercial banks will utilise repayments of advances already granted only for the purpose of granting credit for essential purposes.
A. B A N D A R A N A Y A K E Chief Accountant
H. E. T E N N E K O O N
Governor
